tag_line: Smart conflict resolver for BeamNG mod files
title: Mod Conflict Resolver
message:
[B][SIZE=6]Mod Conflict Resolver[/SIZE][/B]

Ever had one mod overwrite another? Missing features because two mods touched the same files? [B]This tool fixes that.[/B]

[SIZE=4][U] What It Does[/U][/SIZE]

This mod automatically detects and resolves conflicts between active mods that try to edit the same files—like keyboard binding configs (`.json`) or behavior scripts (`.lua`).

[SIZE=4][U] Key Features[/U][/SIZE]

[LIST]
[*][B]Finds Conflicts:[/B] Scans all active mods for duplicate file paths (e.g., `/vehicles/etki/input_actions.json`).
[*][B]Smart Merging:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Performs [I]deep merges[/I] of conflicting [B]JSON files[/B], such as custom keybinds. If two mods add different bindings to the same car, you’ll get [B]both[/B].
[*]Analyzes and merges [B]Lua scripts[/B], combining logic from different mods (for supported vehicle script patterns).
[/LIST]
[*][B]Creates a New Merged Mod:[/B] Saves the result to `[I]/mods/ModConflictResolutions/[/I]`, which loads as a high-priority patch.
[*][B]Automatic and Background Friendly:[/B] Re-evaluates conflicts every time you enable/disable a mod.
[/LIST]

[SIZE=4][U] Example[/U][/SIZE]

Say one mod adds a custom horn keybind to a car, and another mod adds a boost activation keybind. Normally, the last mod loaded would overwrite the other—[B]you’d lose one feature[/B]. With this resolver, [B]both bindings are preserved and fully functional[/B].
[ATTACH=full]1244182[/ATTACH]

[SIZE=4][U] Installation[/U][/SIZE]

Just install like a normal mod—no setup needed. It will start resolving conflicts as soon as it’s enabled.

[SIZE=4][U] TLDR [/U][/SIZE]

This tool is a must-have for heavy mod users or developers who want maximum compatibility. It keeps the game stable and makes sure no good feature goes to waste.
via: packed by repo on Mon, 21 Jul 2025 01:04:09 GMT
